page.title: 17Sea defences Sheerness
page.content: There have been four types of{sea {defence,}the present wall being completed in November 1983. The original wall was the Shingle Bank built to a height of 3.5 metres. As it was low there was a risk of{flooding and the second wall, called the Promenade was built about 4.6 metres in height. The third sea wall called the Garages was built in 1933 and provided garages for local residents and a{ sea wall at a height of 6.1 metres. This wall also proved ineffective as in 1953 severe flooding occured in most of Sheerness. The fourth and safest wall has been constructed to a height of 7.25 metres and is curved so that the water rebounds.This design has made it a feature of the{landscape.
